Japanese: いいところにきましたね。
English: You came at a good time.

Japanese:
完成したところなんですよ。
最強の人形がね。
English:
We've completed it.
The strongest mech, that is.
Oooh! You too, huh?!

Japanese:
その口ぶりだと、
他の工房の様子も
見てきたようですね。
English: Saying that makes it sound like you've been to see the other workshops.

Japanese:
でも、弓工房では
本当に最強の人形を
完成させましたよ。
English: But, here at the Bow Workshop, we are the only ones who have made a mech that can truly be called the strongest.

Japanese: ずいぶん、自信ありそうだな。
English: You certainly seem to be rather confident.
That's only natural.
Do you want it?

Japanese:
もし、模擬戦で
勝つことができたら、
売ってあげてもいいですが。
English: If you can best it in an practise match, I'll consider selling it to you.

Japanese: その勝負、受けて立つぜ！
English: We accept your challenge!

Japanese:
こちらも実戦のデータがとれて
助かります。
English: We'll be keeping the combat data for future record.
So, prepare yourself.
This is the /c5Crossbow Mech/c3.

Japanese:
弩弓人形の武器はもちろん弓。
ですが、弓の中でも最も高い破
壊力を持つ/c5クロスボウ/c3なのです。
English: The Crossbow Mech's weapon is a bow, of course. However, it possesses the most destructive power amongst all bows, the /c5crossbow/c3.

Japanese:
破壊力において、
長弓をはるかに上回ります。
English: It's power far exceeds that of a long bow.

Japanese:
すごいでしょう。
これが弓工房最強の人形です。
English:
Isn't it incredible?
This is the Bow Workshop's strongest mech.

Japanese:
ただ、攻略のヒントも出して
おきましょう。公平な条件で
データをとるためにね。
English: Though, I'll give you some strategy hints, free of charge. We want to make sure it's a fair test for our data after all.

Japanese:
クロスボウは強力すぎるため、
弓を引くのに時間がかかる、
という欠点があるのです。
English: Because the crossbow is so powerful, it has a downside of taking a long time to draw.

Japanese:
射撃後、次の発射まで
かなりの間が空くことに
なります。
English: After firing, there will be a long delay before the next shot.

Japanese:
最初の一撃を避けることが
できれば、/p君にも
チャンスが生まれるでしょう。
English: If he's able to avoid that initial strike, /p will have a chance.
Let's go!
